title: You didn't really think you could install Ruby through npm, did you?
body:
My install process.

``` bash
➜  Sites  react-native init JakeProject   
This will walk you through creating a new React Native project in /Users/jspurloc/Sites/JakeProject

> ws@0.4.31 install /Users/jspurloc/Sites/JakeProject/node_modules/react-native/node_modules/ws
> (node-gyp rebuild 2> builderror.log) || (exit 0)

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/bufferutil/src/bufferutil.o
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/bufferutil.node
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/bufferutil.node: Finished
  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/validation/src/validation.o
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/validation.node
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/validation.node: Finished
react-native@0.3.1 node_modules/react-native
├── absolute-path@0.0.0
├── stacktrace-parser@0.1.1
├── react-timer-mixin@0.13.1
├── underscore@1.7.0
├── q@1.0.1
├── debug@2.1.3 (ms@0.7.0)
├── yargs@1.3.2
├── optimist@0.6.1 (wordwrap@0.0.2, minimist@0.0.10)
├── worker-farm@1.1.0 (xtend@4.0.0, errno@0.1.2)
├── source-map@0.1.31 (amdefine@0.1.0)
├── sane@1.0.1 (watch@0.10.0, fb-watchman@0.0.0, minimatch@0.2.14, walker@1.0.6)
├── uglify-js@2.4.17 (uglify-to-browserify@1.0.2, async@0.2.10, yargs@1.3.3, source-map@0.1.34)
├── rebound@0.0.12
├── connect@2.8.3 (methods@0.0.1, uid2@0.0.2, fresh@0.1.0, cookie-signature@1.0.1, pause@0.0.1, qs@0.6.5, bytes@0.2.0, buffer-crc32@0.2.1, cookie@0.1.0, send@0.1.2, formidable@1.0.14)
├── jstransform@10.0.1 (base62@0.1.1, esprima-fb@13001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb)
├── joi@5.1.0 (topo@1.0.2, isemail@1.1.1, hoek@2.12.0, moment@2.9.0)
├── module-deps@3.5.6 (inherits@2.0.1, shallow-copy@0.0.1, minimist@0.2.0, subarg@0.0.1, parents@1.0.1, stream-combiner2@1.0.2, readable-stream@1.0.33, resolve@0.7.4, through2@0.4.2, duplexer2@0.0.2, concat-stream@1.4.7, browser-resolve@1.8.2, JSONStream@0.7.4, detective@3.1.0)
├── ws@0.4.31 (tinycolor@0.0.1, options@0.0.6, commander@0.6.1, nan@0.3.2)
└── react-tools@0.13.0-rc2 (commoner@0.10.1)
You didn't really think you could install Ruby through npm, did you?
➜  Sites  cd JakeProject 
➜  JakeProject  ls
node_modules package.json
➜  JakeProject  
```

So, what does this mean? You didn't really think you could install Ruby through npm, did you?
